alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:42AM EST until December 18 at 8:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...River Flooding is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following county, Sussex. * WHEN...Until noon EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding is expected to occur along the Nottoway River at Stony Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 AM EST, the Nottoway River at Stony Creek continues to rise after recent heavy rainfall. The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 16.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - For Nottoway River at Stony Creek: At 4:30am the stage was 12.15 feet. Flood Stage is 15.0 feet. Forecast: A crest of 16.8 feet is expected at 1:00am Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
